person.occupation: Manager of the German national football team

application.label: EXMARaLDA Partitur-Editor
application.desc: Transcription Tool providing a TEI Export

revisionDesc.change: Created by XSL transformation from an EXMARaLDA basic transcription

spanGrp.span: the story with the lowest point.
Today we played against the group leader.
That is certainly not all right.
That's a bit too little for our standards.
We are vice world champion, we need to give a little more.
We should really think about whether this/ whether we want to go in that way in the future!
story, dragging everything down, dragging everything into the mud!
And I'm not going to take it any longer.

incident.desc: im Folgenden zusätzlich vorübergehend hochgezogene Stirn, weit geöffnete Augen
"winkt" mit erhobenem Zeigefinger der LH, zieht Stirn hoch

spanGrp.span: Rudi, can I return to the game again?
So, there is this Icelandic Team.
Most of the players are playing in the second division in England, and even there, they're not starters.
We should then, considering our position, considering our line-up,
Oh, and why should we clearly outplay the team?

incident.desc: weiterhin aggressive und hektische Gestik und (LA, KO, OK) Mimik

spanGrp.span: Are they group leaders or not?
And then we're supposed to outplay our opponent in an away game?
Where in what world are we/ are you living?
For each position, if I compare them one-to-one…

incident.desc: beugt OK zu RV nach vorn, gestikulieret mit RA
beugt OK zu WH nach vorn, streckt LA in Richtung WHs gestikulierenden RA aus

spanGrp.span: But I did/ I did say the team…
I did say the team/ I did say the team wasn't playing well.
• There wasn't enough willingness to run.
Wednesday, only those people are going to play, who are really working their asses off.
You really have to get off your high horses!
You're always so full of ideas about what we/ what kind of football we have to play in Germany!
They were playing utter crap football!
You really couldn't went there those days.
I mean, they were playing pedestrian football back then!

incident.desc: Gestik im Folgenden weniger aggressiv und hektisch, dafür "energischer" (LA)
im Folgenden wieder aggressive und hektische Gestik (LA, KO, OK) und Mimik
lässt die RH (Mikro) sinken, zupft mit LH an seinem Strumpf

spanGrp.span: Well, I'm getting back to that.
And we most often agree on how to evaluate these games.
I don't really know, how this got so tense all of a sudden, why I…

incident.desc: legt RH für einen Moment an seine Brust

spanGrp.span: Do we have to put up with everything?
Well I really didn't make this tense.
Now, there is no wheat beer in Iceland as far as I…
Eh eh, to tell the truth, ((breathes in)) I'm not a wheat beer drinker.
And I don't know if he's going to go on like this.
((breathes in)) Well you said it: Cause now we're there, where we were.
Why don't we get to the (point) where we've been for quite some time?
Eh˙ • wednesday those who are working their asses off have to be there.
Are they sitting on the bench or were they on the field today?
And why didn't they do it today?
You're just sitting here relaxed and comfy in your chair, just had three wheat beers,

incident.desc: deutet mit der LA mehrfach in Richtung WH
lehnt OK beim Lachen nach hinten
weist mit RH in Richtung RV
nickt. streicht sich über den Schnurrbart
